content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

(a) Draw a correctly labeled graph showing a typical monopolistically competitive firm, Firm <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, in long-run equilibrium, and show each of the following.

(i) The profit-maximizing price, labeled <math alttext="P"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>P</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

(ii) The profit-maximizing quantity, labeled <math alttext="Q"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

(iii) The allocatively and productively efficient levels of output, labeled <math alttext="Q sub 1"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Q sub 2"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively

(b) Is firm <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> making positive accounting profit? Explain.

(c) Suppose, over the long run, that the Gobble Company in a different industry continues to make significantly higher economic profit than Firm <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and most other firms in other industries. What must be true in order for the Gobble Company to make more economic profit than firms in other industries in the long run?

(d) Suppose that Firm <math alttext="Y"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> raises the price of its product which increases the demand for Firm <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>’s product. Is Firm <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>’s product a complement or substitute for Firm <math alttext="Y"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>’s product?

(e) Assume firm <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> discovers a new way to display its product that takes customers away from its competitors.

(i) What effect would this have on Firm <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>’s economic profits in the short run? Explain.

(ii) Assume that, in time, competitors copy Firm <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>’s new display. What effect would this have on Firm <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>’s economic profits in the long run? Explain.
